expel.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to officially force someone to leave a school or organization
expel.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Two girls were expelled from school for taking drugs.
The main opposition leader was expelled from her party.
He was expelled for making racist remarks.
expel.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to force a foreigner to leave a country, especially because they have broken the law or for political reasons
expel.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Foreign priests were expelled from the country.
Three diplomats were expelled for spying.
expel.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to force air, water, or gas etc out of your body or out of a container
expel.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to officially make someone leave a country or an organization
expel.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: In the past, the government found it legally difficult to identify and expel illegal immigrants.
The governing body will try to expel the members from the trade union.
